abstract: The lable Lika Mimika creates espadrilles in unisex styles, in soft lamb, goat and calfskin, are hand-stitched in Spain and come in a range of neutrals and pop colors.
lead_paragraph: MARIJANA CONDIC and Lisa Leipziger, friends in Frankfurt, had a modest mission: to make espadrilles that were sturdier than the Spanish styles they love to wear. "I came back from holiday in Spain and told Marijana we have to do something special with espadrilles so they don't fall apart after a month," Ms. Leipziger said. Their label, Lika Mimika, is the happy result. The unisex styles, in soft lamb, goat and calfskin, are hand-stitched in Spain and come in a range of neutrals and Pop colors. Two new styles, lined with rabbit fur or curly lamb shearling, are a clever travel shoe: cozy for the flight and vacation-ready upon landing.
